video.title: Build a chat application like Slack - React / JavaScript Tutorial
video.description:
Learn how to build a complete chat application with typing indicators, “who’s online list”, and message history in this React / JavaScript tutorial.

In this screencast, you’ll learn how to build a team communication chat application similar to Slack using React on the front-end and Chatkit on the back-end. Sign up here: https://pusher.com/chatkit 

▼ Follow Booker ▼

on Twitter: https://twitter.com/bookercodes
on GitHub: https://github.com/bookercodes

 ▼ Links (in the order they’re mentioned)▼

Starter template: https://github.com/bookercodes/react-slack-clone-starter-template
Complete code: https://github.com/pusher/build-a-slack-clone-with-react-and-pusher-chatkit
Step by step written tutorial: https://github.com/pusher/build-a-slack-clone-with-react-and-pusher-chatkit
Chatkit Slack group: https://feedback-beta.pusher.com/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

replies.author: Ythalo Saldanha

Probably he is using an mechanical keyboard. 
This kind of keyboard usually emits sounds like that.

topLevelComment.author: Stephen St.Pierre
topLevelComment.text: Really cool! One question though, why use constructor and .bind instead of just using arrow functions? Arrow function methods save you 4 lines off the bat and 1 line for each additional method.

replies.author: Scott Berry
replies.text:
Nah, he just didn't know, it's an old style, which future people who do React will be annoyed about, doing the arrow function is far more clearer and less boiler code.

The previous was more of a hack than anything else.

replies.author: r3d0c
replies.text: Good programming etiquette; you want the markdown to be as simple to read as possible and avoid clutter
